body_html:
If you use @kuangliu suggestion of using CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=1,2,3 you need to set gpu_ids = [0,1,2] because what the env variable is going to do is make sure that if you ask for device 0, you get 1, if you ask for 1, you get 2 etc...

In your case, if you say you training code works but not your validation, you may want to check what are the difference between them if you don't want to go with the CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES solution.
In particular, make sure that you set the use_gpu argument and everything else in the same way.

body:
If you use @kuangliu suggestion of using `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=1,2,3` you need to set `gpu_ids = [0,1,2]` because what the env variable is going to do is make sure that if you ask for device 0, you get 1, if you ask for 1, you get 2 etc...

In your case, if you say you training code works but not your validation, you may want to check what are the difference between them if you don't want to go with the `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES` solution.
In particular, make sure that you set the `use_gpu` argument and everything else in the same way.
